CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Engineering and Environment Department, block 1, floor 6, Civic Offices, Wood Quay

CONTACT_DATA.ADDRESS: Engineering and Environment Department, block 1, floor 6, Civic Offices, Wood Quay

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Framework agreement for consultant engineering services for flood defence works in Dublin.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Suitability assessment submissions are invited from suitably quailfied service providers for short listing and subsequent admittance to the framework agreement for consultant engineering services for flood defence works in Dublin - government standard conditions of engagement stages (ii) to (v).
Note: to register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the eTenders web site at http://www.etenders.gov.ie/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=183678.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Scope includes a full range of services including (but not limited to):
— Carry out all duties of consultant under new public works conditions of engagement,
— Detailed design of flood defence schemes,
— Undertake statutory processes required for the construction of flood defence schemes, such as part 8 planning permissions and environmental impact statements,
— Provide (and present) quarterly progress presentations to local area committee members at council meetings and other relevant stakeholders,
— Participate in consultant audits, which may be required from time to time,
— Be generally responsible for securing any additional third party services that are identified as being necessary to assist Dublin City Council (DCC) in advancing the project,
— Produce tender documents,
— Carry out suitability assessment and tender assessment for procuring contractor services,
— Review previous studies carried out,
— Liaise with relevant stakeholders as required,
— Generally comply with the requirements of the Office of Public Works (OPW) and with DCC project management procedures,
— Check main contractors insurances, performance bond, tax clearance, collateral warranty, and parent company guarantee,
— Provide construction supervision services,
— Carry out PSDP and Designer duties and reporting to client under the Safety Health and Welfare Construction Regulations 2006,
— Progress reporting and client meeting,
— Carry out design work for approved change orders identified by client, employers representative and consultant,
— Establish and keep updated risk allocation matrix as changes occur,
— Issue certificate of substantial completion,
— Management of issues during maintenance period,
— Issue certificates of final completion,
— Production of final account within 90 days of certificate of final completion,
— Production of as built Drawings,
— Management and delivery of client safety file.

The work will be carried out within the Dublin City Council boundary as well as sites Dublin City Council is responsible for that lie outside of the Dublin City Council boundaries. It will encompass work in busy urban environments with high traffic densities, high density of existing underground services and multiple local stakeholders.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: As stated in prequalification documents on www.etenders.gov.ie.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: As stated in prequalification documents on www.etenders.gov.ie.

EAF_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: As stated in prequalification documents on www.etenders.gov.ie.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: As stated in prequalification documents on www.etenders.gov.ie.

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: As stated in prequalification documents on www.etenders.gov.ie.

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: As stated in prequalification documents on www.etenders.gov.ie.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: Submissions shall be retuned to the address in Annex A of this notice by the time and date in Section IV.3.4 of the notice.
Applicants are reminded that failure to provide the requested information, or the provision of incomplete, false or misleading information will result in their exclusion from the procurement process.
Applicants are advised to retain a full and accurate copy of their submission.

Applicants for pre-qualification must return four (4) printed copies and one copy on CD of their pre-qualification submission which shall be in a sealed envelope clearly marked "framework agreement for consultant engineering services for flood defence works in Dublin - government standard conditions of engagement stages (ii) to (v)".

Dublin City Council is subject to the provisions of the Freedom of Information (FOI) Acts 1997 and 2003. If an applicant considers that any information supplied is commercially sensitive or confidential in nature, this should be highlighted and the reasons for its sensitivity specified. In such cases the relevant material may, subject to the provisions of the Act, be protected from access in response to a FOI request.

It will be a condition for the award of any contract by Dublin City Council that the successful tenderer, and all subcontractors produce a valid tax clearance certificate or C2 certificate from the Revenue Commissioners. In the case of a non-resident tenderer, a statement of suitability from the Revenue Commissioners will be required.
Suppliers must register their interest on the etenders web site in order to be included on the mailing list for clarifications.

Please note in relation to all documents, that where reference is made to a particular standard, make, source, process, trademark, type or patent, that this is not to be regarded as a defacto requirement. In all such cases it should be understood that such indications are to be treated strictly and solely for reference purposes only, to which the words "or equivalent" will always be appended.

This notice and the pre-qualification and protocol documents, including clarifications and changes, will be published on the Irish Government Procurement Opportunities Portal (www.etenders.gov.ie) only. Registration is free of charge.
Dublin City Council will not accept responsibility for information relayed (or not relayed) via third parties.
The framework agreement is primarily for use by the environment and engineering department, but may also be extended for use by other divisions of Dublin City Council as requirements arise.
Emailed/faxed/late tenders will not be accepted.
